loans.name: Jesuwehuhlontche Group

texts.fr: JESUWEHUHLONTCHE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Florentine Mahoutin (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 42 ans et est mariée à un certain Cosme. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Florentine Mahoutin a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Florentine Mahoutin vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de trois ans, Florentine Mahoutin vend des produits de quincaillerie à son domicile. Florentine Mahoutin s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la troisième fois que Florentine Mahoutin et les autres membres du groupe JESUWEHUHLONTCHE sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
JESUWEHUHLONTCHE is a group of three people who are all friends. The representative of the group is called Florentine Mahoutin (pictured with her hand raised in the photo), and she is 42 years of age and married to Cosme. The couple has two children, both at school and under their care. Florentine Mahoutin stopped going to school at elementary level. 

Florentine Mahoutin lives with her children and husband and, together with him, ensures that the various household expenses are met. For almost three years she has sold hardware products from her home. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

This is the third time that Florentine Mahoutin and the other members of the JESUWEHUHLONTCHE group have requested the financial support of ALIDé. They have done so to increase their working capital and strengthen their business, as well as to better meet the needs of their customers. The first two loans they were given have been successfully repaid.

loans.use: To buy hardware goods.

loans.name: Fifonsi Group

texts.fr: FIFONSI est un groupement de treize personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Micheline (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un certain Dieudonné. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés dont un reste à leur charge. Micheline vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes besoins de la maison. Depuis près de vingt ans, Micheline vend des produits cosmétiques. Parallèlement à cette activité, Micheline vend des jus de bissap dans un village du Bénin. Micheline s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Micheline et les autres membres du groupe FIFONSI sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
FIFONSI is a group of 13 people who all live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group is called Micheline (pictured with her hand raised in the photo), and she is 37 years of age and married to Dieudonné. The couple has two children, both at school and one of whom is still in their care.

Micheline lives with her children and husband, and together the couple ensures that the various household needs are met. For almost 20 years Micheline has sold cosmetic products. In addition to this business, she also sells hibiscus flower juice in a village in Benin. Micheline gets her supplies from a village in Benin. 

This is the second time that Micheline and the other members of the FIFONSI group have requested the financial support of ALIDé. They have done so to increase their working capital and strengthen their business, as well as to better meet their customers’ requests. The previous loan they received was successfully repaid.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions, weaves and other cosmetic products.

loans.name: Julio Fautino

texts.es:
La pesca es una de las actividades mas conocida en la ciudad de Granada debido a que se encuentra rodeada de un sin numero de isletas,hermosos paisajes y un gran lago, en las isletas de Granada se encuentran diferentes especies de pescados como son las curbina, guapote, tilapia, entre otros. La pesca se ha convertido en un medio turístico y una manera de subsistir de las personas que habitan en las zonas aledañas a las islas de Granada como es el caso de don Julio un humilde pescador de 58 años de edad originario de Diriomo que navegando en medio de las hermosas islas que tiene Granada sale todos los días a pescar, Su lancha y sus dos remos son los medios de trabajo de don Julio. Inicio su actividad con un taller de pequeña industria de madera haciendo lanchas, luego tuvo la oportunidad de dedicarse a la pesca, miro que el negocio era bueno generaba mas ganancias, el vende a los clientes sus productos por libra. Su esposa lo apoya con los ingresos que ella obtiene de la venta de comida y bebida que tiene en su casa de habitación, el comercializa sus productos en el mismo sector y en los alrededores de la comunidad también cuenta con sus clientes fijos.

Sus planes futuros es invertir en la compra de una nueva lancha para tener mas facilidades de trabajo ya que por el momento solo cuenta con una lancha propia y la otra que la alquila. Solicito el préstamo para invertir en la reparación de su lancha que sera de ayuda porque podra darle mantenimiento que permita un mejor funcionamiento de su medio de trabajo con el objetivo de mantener su negocio activo, Su meta próxima es mantener su negocio, obtener mayores ventas que le generen más ingresos para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Fishing is one of the best known activities in the city of Granada, since it is surrounded by a large number of islands, beautiful views and a large lake.  In the islands of Granada can be found different species of fish such as curbina, guapote and tilapia, among others.  Fishing has become a tourist attraction and a mode of subsistence for the people who live in the environs of the islands of Granada as is the case of don Julio, a humble fisherman of 58 years old, originally from Diriomo, who navigates between the beautiful islands that Granada has.  He goes out everyday to fish.  His boat and his two paddles are the means of labor of don Julio.  He began his activity with a workshop for small wood industry making boats.  Later he had the opportunity to start fishing.  He saw that the work was enjoyable and generated more revenue.  He sells products to his customers by the pound.

His wife helps with the income that she gets from the sale of food and drink that she has in their house.  He sells his products in the same area and in the surrounding areas of the community and also has steady customers.  His future plans are to invest in the purchase of a new boat to have more tools for work since for now he only has the boat that he owns and another that he rents.  He is requesting the loan to invest in the repair of his boat which will be a help since being able to give it maintenance will allow better functioning of his means of work with the objective of maintaining an active business.  His next goals are to maintain his business and have better sales that will generate more income to get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to invest in the repair of his boat.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: Le représentant du groupe d’affaire Tuongozane est un  entrepreneur courageux et secrétaire du groupe, marié, responsable de 8 enfants dont 6 vont à l’école. Il s’entraide avec son épouse dans leur petit business. Il  est vendeur des denrées alimentaires. Il expose sa marchandise au marché  central de Virunga. Il ya 13 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Il démarra son business avec de fonds propre issu d’une petite commission de vente parcelle de son voisin. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec des 10 régimes de bananes et la moitié sera affectée à l’épargne. En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son capital, scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison en dur. Le client  remercie grandement l’IMF Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique.
texts.en:
The representative of the business group Tuongozane is a brave entrepreneur who is also the group’s secretary. He is married with eight dependent children, six of whom go to school. He and his wife help each other in running their small business. He has been selling foodstuffs for 13 years, and displays his merchandise at the central market of Virunga. He started his business with his own funds, a small commission earned on the sale of land to a neighbor. 

He will use this new loan to buy ten bunches of bananas, keeping half of the credit for his savings.  He plans to bolster his working capital, pay for his children’s tuition and build a proper house.

He wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for helping the poor who cannot turn to traditional banks.

loans.use: to buy bananas for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Nancy Lucila

texts.es: Nancy vive en Playas desde que era niña, ahora a sus 42 años alquila una casa donde vive con sus tres hijos quienes tienen 16, 6 y 4 años de edad. Es madre soltera ya que hace varios años se separo de su esposo. Ella empezó hace 8 años la venta de productos de maquillaje y ropa por catalogo, a raíz de la separación ya que necesita tener ingresos para sus hijos y a la vez no descuidarlos. Este tipo de negocio le facilita su cuidado ya que puede manejar su horario sin problemas. Nancy nos comenta que ahora tiene muchos clientes pero esto se debe a trabaja muy duro. Sale a promocionar sus productos tres días a la semana y los otros dos días los dedica a la cobranza. No lo realiza sola ya que lleva a su hija menor porque no estudia, por ese motivo la lleva a todas partes donde realiza el trabajo. Con el préstamo solicitado espera comprar ropa, maquillaje, cremas, perfume para poderlos ofrecer y vender. Su sueño a futuro es ponerse un local donde exhibir sus productos y poder conocer más clientes potenciales. En lo familiar desea continuar bien de salud para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nancy has lived in Playas since she was a little girl.  Now, at the age of 42, she rents a house where she lives with her three children, 16, 6, and 4.  She is a single mother because she separated from her husband several years ago.  Eight years ago she began selling make-up products and clothing through a catalogue.  Because of the separation she needed to have income for her children and not neglect them.

This kind of business facilitates caring for them because she can manage her schedule with no problem.  Nancy tells us that now she has a lot of customers but this is because she works very hard.  She goes out to promote her products three days a week and devotes the other two days to collecting.  She doesn't do it alone; she takes her youngest daughter because she's not in school, so Nancy takes her everywhere when she is working.

With the loan requested she hopes to buy clothing, make-up, creams, and perfume to offer and sell.

Her dream for the future is to set up a store for herself to show her products and be able to meet more potential customers.  With regard to her family, she wants to continue in good health for herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy make-up, creams, and perfume.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: Bernardo, un hombre de 61 años, procedente de Santa Cruz de Mompox, hermoso municipio, ubicado a orillas del Rio Magdalena, nació en una familia tradicionalmente ganadera y desde sus 17 años se trasladó con ella a la ciudad e Barranquilla. Como para no perder la conexión con su pueblo natal, emprendió su propio negocio, interpretando intuitivamente las necesidades de un segmento de mercado y la forma de acceder a productos alimenticos de excelencia producidos en  Santa Cruz de Mompox y finalmente con su experiencia de vida logró trasladar hasta Barranquilla, artículos de consumos diario, para venderlos en un mercado que los demandaba, atendiendo la oferta de Bernardo. Así fue como  inició su primera experiencia,  con vecinos y amigos vendiéndoles suero, queso, bollos de maíz. Poco a poco la calidad de los productos que vendía dio sus propios resultados y hoy ha consolidado una clientela y un buen nombre en el mercado. Así mismo ha logrado un capital de trabajo, que invierte en su negocio y con sus utilidades  apoya  el sostenimiento de su hogar, hasta llegar a incursionar en el mercado   de la compra y venta de ganado vacuno  en pie y esto lo hace  en el municipio que lo vio nacer. Últimamente ante las posibilidades de adquirir todos los productos que ofrece, para responder a la creciente demanda y ante la necesidad  fortalecer su negocio de ganado, encuentra que su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente para lograrlo, por eso acude a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará queso, bollo, suero, galletas y un toro. Su credikiva es el segundo financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con este apoyo logró aumentar su liquidez, las ventas y sus utilidades, así mismo terminó de construir el segundo piso de su vivienda y esto lo hace sentir  satisfecho y con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando para aumentar sus posibilidades de bienestar y lograr sus sueños de prosperidad.
texts.en: Bernardo is a 61-year-old man who comes from Santa Cruz de Mompox, a beautiful municipality located on the banks of the Magdalena River. He was born in a family of stockbreeders, and at the age of 17 he moved with them in the town Barranquilla. In order not to lose connection with his native village, he started his own activity understanding intuitively the needs of a market segment and, thanks to his own experience in the field he succeeded in finding the way to acquire excellent quality food produced in Santa Cruz de Mompox, to finally bringing to Barranquilla basic necessities products to sell them to customers who were requesting them and who turned to Bernardo because of what he offered, He started his activity selling at first whey, cheese and corn 'bollos' (corn and cheese-based wraps) to his friends and neighbors. Little by little, the good impact of the quality of the products he sold has allowed him to gain established customers and to make a good name for himself in the market. In this way, he has succeeded in earning a working capital that he invests in his activity, supporting his household though his profits. He has even succeeded in entering the cattle market buying and selling it in the municipality he was born in. He has recently noticed that his working capital is not enough to face the growing requests and his need to strengthen the cattle activity: this is why has requested a loan that he will use to buy cheese, “bollos”, whey, biscuits and a bull. This is the second loan he has asked to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, the first having been used to increase his liquidity, his sales and his profits, as well as to finish building the second floor of his house. This makes his feel satisfied with himself and with great desire to keep on working to increase his standard of living and to achieve his dreams of success.

loans.use: To buy cheese, “bollos”, whey, biscuits and a bull.

loans.name: Paola Lourdes

texts.es: Paola vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil. Tiene 37 años de edad y vive en la casa de su propiedad con su hijo ya que su esposo falleció hace 4 años. Su hijo tiene 18 años y de momento se encuentra ejerciendo el servicio militar. Paola confecciona manualidades las cuales vende en su domicilio. Ella nos cuenta que empezó el negocio traveseando, es decir que cortaba moldes y hacia experimentos con ellos, poco a poco le fue gustando por lo empezó varios cursos e hizo de esto su negocio. Al principio se le hizo difícil ya que tenía que promocionar para crear su cartera de clientes. Hace 5 años que inicio el negocio y ahora le va muy bien trabajando todos los días desde las 9 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde ya que tiene otro trabajo. Como es madre soltera tiene 2 trabajos y gracias a eso y al esfuerzo de su trabajo ha salido adelante hasta la fecha.  Paola nos comenta que una de sus dificultades es la ubicación ya que quisiera poder ubicarlo en la parte exterior de su casa, abriendo un local amplio donde pueda exhibir las manualidades que realiza. Con el crédito comprara material para la confección como fomix, telas, lanas, hilos y demás. Espera continuar trabajando para seguir apoyando a su hijo y que siga adelante en la profesión que elija.
texts.en: Paola, 37, lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil.  She and her son live in a house that she owns.  Her husband died 4 years ago.  Her 18-year old son just started military service.  Paola earns her living making and selling party supplies.  She operates the business from her house.  She says that she stumbled into the business, by which she means that she started it after making cut-outs and playing around with them.  She liked the results and realized that she could make a business selling them.  It was hard at first because she had to find customers.  That was 5 years ago and now she has a steady stream of customers.  She works from 9:00 in the morning until 1:00 in the afternoon when she leaves for her other job.  She needs 2 jobs because that's what it takes when you're a single mother with a growing boy.  Paola says that she would like to set up a larger space in her house where she can sell her products.  She will use this loan to buy the supplies she needs--cloth, threads, etc.--to operate her business.  She hopes to continue working so that she can help her son pursue whatever career he chooses.

loans.use: to buy materials for her party supply business.

loans.name: Graciela Yanira

texts.es: Graciela tiene 45 años viviendo en Playas, el sector donde tiene su casa es uno de los pocos que cuentan con los servicios básicos y pavimentación, agradece a las autoridades de que poco a poco estén mejorando la ciudad que es un lugar muy turístico. Hace 22 años aprendió peluquería, maquillaje lo que hizo su profesión. En la actualidad tiene muchos clientes desde hombres, mujeres y niños que prefieren su atención porque la conocen desde hace mucho tiempo. Graciela nos comenta que hace 3 años atrás también empezó a vender productos de belleza por el sector laborando de lunes a viernes desde las 9 hasta las 5 de la tarde. En su gabinete ofrece cortes con estilo, permanentes, alisados, maquillaje, arreglo de uñas y demás. Le gusta lo que realiza ya que permite cuidar de sus hijas quienes están en la etapa escolar y asisten a la escuela fiscal de Playas. Con el préstamo que está solicitando comprara tintes, ampollas para el cabello, esmaltes y herramientas para el gabinete. Espera mejorar sus ingresos para arreglar un poco el local.
texts.en: Graciela is 45 years old and lives in Playas.  The sector where she has her house is one of the few that includes basic services and paved roads.  She is grateful to the authorities that little by little they are improving the city, which is a very touristy place.  22 years ago she learned hairdressing and make-up, which she made into her profession.  Currently she has many clients, including men, women and children, who prefer her attention because they have known her for a long time.  Graciela tells us that three years ago she also began selling beauty products in the area, working Monday to Friday from 9am until 5pm.  In her shop she offers styled cuts, permanents, straightening, make-up, manicures and more.  She likes what she does since it permits her to care for her daughters, who are school age and attend the public school of Playas.  With the loan that she is requesting she will purchase hair dye, hair conditioners, nail polish, and tools for her salon.  She hopes to improve her income in order to improve the salon a bit.

loans.use: to purchase hair dye, hair conditioners, nail polish, and tools for her salon.

loans.name: Margarita Florinda

texts.es:
La señora Margarita Florinda de 37 años de edad se caracteriza por ser una señora amable, trabajadora e indígena, originaria de la ciudad de Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca. Una de las artesanías más representativas de esta ciudad son las máscaras de madera  pintadas en brillantes colores que representan distintos animales.

Doña Margarita, como es mejor conocida, se dedica a la venta de refacciones para motobombas desde hace ocho años. Ella menciona que tiene un pequeño local ubicado en su comunidad donde exhibe y vende su mercancía. Margarita tiene dos hijos: Dulce y Pedro quienes al salir de la escuela pasan el tiempo con su madre acompañándola en el negocio. Uno de los sueños de Doña Margarita es tener un local donde pueda vender sistemas de riego ya que le gusta mucho todo lo relacionado con la agricultura.

Ella pidió el crédito para comprar más refacciones para motobombas. Le da las gracias a Vision Fund por ayudarla y ser parte de su negocio y sobre todo por ayudarla para obtener sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Margarita Florinda, 37, distinguishes herself as a kind and hardworking indigenous woman, a native of the city of Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca.  One of the handicrafts most representative of this city are the wood masks of different animals painted in brilliant colors.

Margarita, as she is better known, has sold spare parts for pumps for eight years.  She mentions that she has a small store in her community where she shows and sells her merchandise.  Margarita has two children, Dulce and Pedro, who spend their time with their mother in the business when they get out of school.  One of Margarita's dreams is to have a store where she can sell irrigation systems, because she loves everything related to agriculture.

She requested the loan to buy more spare parts for pumps.  She thanks Vision Fund for helping her, for being part of her business, and above all for helping her to get her income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for pumps.

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine is single and 29 years old. She lives in Tangub City with her child. 

Cristine operates a sari-sari (convenience) store to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than two years. She earns 3,000 PHP every month. 

Cristine is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo (chocolate malt drink), shampoo, soaps, etc. She joined GDMPC this year. In the future, Cristine hopes that her business will be more progressive.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo (chocolate malt drink), shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Erika Lorena

texts.es: Erika vive en Duran en una casa de su propiedad. Su casa es de 2 plantas de cemento y cuenta con los servicios básicos, no hay alcantarillado ni camino pavimentado pero le gusta su barrio por ser tranquilo y tener excelentes vecinos. A sus 30 años, Erika está soltera y no tiene niños, su profesión es la docencia. Nos comenta que le gustan muchos los niños, sobre todo en tan corta edad ya que es en la etapa primaria donde se crean las bases de su formación como adulto. Da clases en una escuela particular por su domicilio a niños de primero de básica. También da clases de nivelación en su domicilio por las tardes cobrando $ 3.00 la hora, le va bien porque hay niños que sus padres trabajan y no los pueden ayudar con las tareas. En la actualidad lo que le hace falta es una computadora porque hay niños que necesitan aprender a usarla por eso solicita el préstamo para la compra de una. Erika es una profesora muy entregada a su profesión y nos menciona que su mayor sueño es poder tener una escuela propia.
texts.en: Erika lives in her own home in Duran.  It’s a two story cement house that includes basic services.   It does not include sewage nor paved roads, but she likes the neighborhood because it’s quiet and includes excellent neighbors.  At age 30, Erika is single and has no children.  She is a teacher and tells us that she likes children very much, especially during the early stages of their lives where they form the basis of their adulthood.  She teaches basic and elementary education at a private school near her home.  She also does tutoring in her home, charging $3.00 per hour.  Things are going well for her because there are parents who work and are unable to help their children with their homework.  She needs a computer because the children need to learn how to use one.  Erika is a teacher who is very dedicated to her profession and tells us that her greatest dream is having her own school.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Narcisa Antonia

texts.es: Narcisa tiene 40 años viviendo en Playas y se dedica a su tienda de abarrotes ubicada en su domicilio. Está casada con Fernando quien es enderezador y pintor de profesión, tienen 4 hijos de 15, 11 y 7 años de edad, los menores son mellizos y estudian en la escuela fiscal del barrio. Narcisa nos cuenta que hace 2 años empezó sacando copias ya que había comprado una computadora con impresora y scanner, sus cliente eran por lo general estudiantes del sector quienes iban para que les ayude escaneando documentos. De eso surgió la idea de vender artículos de papelería pero tenía muy poca mercadería ya que no tenía dinero para invertir. Por esa razón decidió solicitar un préstamo con lo empezó su tienda de abarrotes ya que tiene más ventas y le muy bien. Se dedica a este negocio todos los días de la semana desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche y la ayudan su esposo e hijos. En su tienda vende principalmente arroz y azúcar por libra, aceite, artículos de limpieza del hogar y personal, víveres, artículos de papelería, lo que comprara con el nuevo crédito para aumentar su inventario. Su meta a futuro es poder juntar ambos negocios ya que la papelería la tiene dentro de su domicilio y la tienda está en la parte frontal de su casa por lo que no da buen aspecto. Espera también surtirlos y mantenerlos estables para poder darles a sus hijos todo no que necesitan.
texts.en: Narcisa, 40, lives in Playas.  She operates a general store in her house.  She and her husband, Fernando, a painter, have 4 children, all in local public schools.  The oldest are 15- and 11-years old, respectively.  The two youngest, twins, are 7-years old.  Narcisa tells us that she started her business selling copy services.  She had bought a computer and printer and her customers--mostly local students--bought scanned copies of their documents from her.  She then realized that she could expand the business by stocking school supplies.  She didn't have a lot of money to invest in inventory, though, so she approached us for her first loan.  In addition to selling school supplies, she now has a general store and tells us that she is happy with her progress.  She works every day, from 7:00 in the morning to 11:00 at night, and still finds time to take care of her family.  She sells school supplies and groceries--rice, sugar, cooking oil, cleaning products, toiletries and other household supplies--that she buys with the money she borrows.  Her plan is to set up a shop large enough for both businesses because they are separate now and the general store is not easy to reach from the street.  She wants to grow the business so that she can help her children in every way that she can.

loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Chreoun

texts.en:
Chreoun is 46 years old and married. She is a loving mother who is responsible for five children. She lives with her husband and children in a small village in the Baray district, in the province of Kompong Tom. 

Chreoun is a very hardworking farmer who raises pigs for the main income of the family. Her husband transports and sells firewood from place to place to ensure good living conditions. One of her sons always goes along with his father to sell the firewood at the marketplace. Her two daughters are now working in a garment factory in Phnom Penh.

Chreoun wants to help her son in his transportation business. This is why she decided to borrow a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to purchase a used motorcycle for her son to use in his business. She hopes that this new business will be successful and will help the family in their financial solvency. In the future, she will continue to support her children’s education and help them earn university degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for her son's transportation business.

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
San, age 32, is married with four children who are still in school. She earns a living through farming rice and raising pigs. She has been in this business for five years. Sometimes she works for others to gain extra income to better support her family. 

This is the second loan for San with VisionFund. Her other group members are new to VisionFund. After the first loan, she was able to earn around 18,000 KHR per day. 

Now, leading her group to apply for a loan, San will use her portion to buy three more pigs and feed for her pigs. With this loan, she hopes to earn more income and save enough money to build a bigger pen and buy more pigs.

loans.use: To buy three more pigs as well as feed for her pigs.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio de 25 años se dedica a la venta de postres y productos congelados derivados de la harina de trigo, los cuales prepara él mismo, después de haber recibido un curso técnico en el SENA, servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje, desde hace 2 años. El negocio funciona en la vivienda donde habita con su familia; Julio prepara deliciosos deditos, empanadas, pastelitos y postres que deleitan a las familias en los diferentes eventos que realizan, siendo principalmente su clientela las cafeterías, del centro de la ciudad, las casas de eventos y los vecinos que acuden a él para repartir sus productos como pasabocas en fiestas y eventos especiales. Sus ventas las realiza de contado, aunque  hay oportunidades en las que ofrece créditos y cuando el mercado aumenta su demanda, la producción la realiza con personas que contrata por evento. En la actualidad la demanda de productos se ha incrementado y el necesita responder a su mercado, pero su capital de trabajo se convierte en su principal desafío, para poder cumplir con su necesidad productiva. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias prima e insumos, para fabricar con sus propias manos, deditos de queso, empanadas de carne, queso y mixtas, entre otros productos congelados, con los que aspira a responder a su clientela mas rentable, que es finalmente la que genera las utilidades, que le permiten aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su bienestar cada vez mas..
texts.en: Julio is 25 years old. He sells desserts and frozen products made with wheat flour: he himself prepares his products, making use of the technical course he has followed 2 years ago at SENA – Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje (National Apprenticeship Service). He has set up his activity in the house where he lives with his family. Julio prepare the delicious “deditos”, empanadas, pies and desserts for the delight of all the families taking part in different events, as his main customers are cafeterias of the city center, the events managing agencies and his neighbors, who buy form him the tasty snacks they offer during their parties and special celebrations. He accepts cash, even thought in some cases he sells by credit; when there is an increase in the requests, he pays extra laborers to help him make his products for the events. The requests for his products have actually increased, and he needs to comply wit his orders; however, in order to satisfy the necessities of his production, he needs to solve his main problem, i.e. his working capital. This is why he has requested a loan, and this is the first he has requested to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use it to buy basing ingredients and supplies to make with his own hands cheese “deditos”, meat empanadas, cheese and “mixtas” (toasted cheese and ham sandwiches) and other frozen products, with which he wishes to satisfy the requests of his more profitable customers, as it is thanks to them that his activity is profitable, allowing him to increase his earnings and to keep on improving his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy ingredient to prepare his products.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana es socia del Bancomunal Fortaleza,es casada y madre de 5 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 2 años. Juana se dedica a la agricultura (siembra de cereales). Está feliz de pertenecer a su Bancomunal porque gracias a las capacitaciones que recibe aprendió a ahorrar y para ella eso es lo más importante, también le gusta asistir porque ahí tiene amigas con quienes comparte diferentes experiencias. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para la siembra de cereales.
texts.en: Juana is a member of the Fortaleza communal bank and has been a member of FINCA Peru for two years.  Juana is married and has five children.  She’s a farmer (raises cereal grains) and glad to be a part of the communal bank because of the training she receives.  She learned how to save and that is the most important thing for her at the moment.  She also likes to attend because she has friends there and they share different experiences.  She will invest the money from this loan to buy fertilizers for her cereal grains.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es: Vicenta es socia del Bancomunal Alianza,es casada y tiene 3 hijos (un varón y dos mujeres). Ella es dueña de una imprenta y es socia de FINCA Perú hace 12 años. Ella dice que gracias a las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal ha aprendido a ser puntual y solidaria y eso le ha servido mucho, le encanta la metodología de trabajo que se aplica en su Bancomunal. Su meta para el futuro es brindarle una buena educación  a su hijo menor y también desea seguir trabajando para progresar al lado de su familia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de materiales e insumos para su imprenta.
texts.en: Vicenta is a member of the Alianza communal bank. She is married and she has three children (one son and two daughters). She is the owner of a printing shop. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for 12 years. She says that thanks to the training she receives in her communal bank, she has learned to be punctual and supportive. This has served her well. She loves the work methodology that is used in the communal bank. Her goal for the future is to give her younger son a good education. She also wants to continue working in order to make progress alongside her family. The loan she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of materials and supplies for her printing shop.

loans.use: purchase of materials and supplies for her printing shop.

loans.name: Wilson Ricardo

texts.es: Wilson vive en Libertad desde que nació hace 28 años. Hace poco logro adquirir una vivienda propia en un sector donde tiene agua y luz falta el alcantarillado y camino pavimentado pero no pierde la esperanza de que en un momento las autoridades terminen este proyecto. Vive con su esposa Bélgica quien es ayudante de guardianía en una vivienda ubicada en Monteverde, es un sector cerca de Libertad conocido turísticamente por sus playas y gastronomía. Sus hijos tienen 11, 9 y 3 años de edad, los 2 mayores asisten a la escuela fiscal. Wilson se dedica al comercio de los mariscos, esta profesión se la debe a su papá quien le enseño la actividad y le entrego su primera embarcación. Nos cuenta que era pequeña y estaba un poco deteriorada, pero no se queja porque le es de mucha utilidad. En la actualidad tiene 2 embarcaciones de fibra y a motor en las cuales realiza la pesca junto a su hermano. La labor la realizan desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 9. Wilson nos informa que increíblemente en este siglo, existen los piratas, quienes roban la pesca y motores de las embarcaciones ocasionando considerables pérdidas, espera no sufrir de este problema en años venideros. Con el préstamo comprara redes por metros, gasolina y un motor usado para poder tener de repuesto. Espera con esto mejorar sus maquinas y aumentar su producción ya que su familia depende del él. Su sueño a futuro es poder terminar la segunda planta de sus casa y así poderle dar más comodidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Wilson has lived in Libertad since he was born 28 years ago.  A short time ago he acquired his own home in an area that has water and electricity.  There's no sewer or paved street, but he's not giving up hope that at some point the authorities will finish this project.  He lives with his wife Bélgica, who is a teacher's assistant in a home day care in Monteverde, an area near Libertad known among tourists for its beaches and gastronomy.

Wilson works in the shellfish business.  He owes this profession to his father, who taught him the job and gave him his first boat.  He tells us that it was little and a bit run down; but he doesn't complain because it is very useful.  Currently he has two craft in which he fishes with his brother, one of fiber and one with a motor.  He works from 5 in the morning until 9.

Wilson tells us that, incredibly, in this century there are pirates who rob the catch and the motors from the boats, creating considerable losses.  He hopes not to have this problem in the coming years.

With the loan he will buy nets by the meter, gasoline, and a motor to be able to use for parts.  With this he hopes to improve his machines and increase his production, because his family depends on him.

His dream for the future is to be able to finish the second story of his house so his children will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy nets, gasoline, and a motor.

loans.name: Khan

texts.en:
Khan is 57 years old. His wife, Meu, is 52 years old. They live in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1982 and have eight children, including two sons and six daughters. 

Khan and his wife are vegetable farmers. Previously, Khan did not have his own property and he built his house on his fellow villager's land. However, he has decided to buy his neighbor’s land. 

Currently, Khan is in the process of building a new house to live in but it is not finished yet. So he asks for a loan in the amount of $500 in order to finish the construction of his house.

loans.use: To finish building his house.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is married and has two children. She is 46 years old and lives in Dimalco, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Erma owns a plot of farm land on which she plants corn to earn a living. She has been in this business for 14 years and earns PHP 4,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

Erma has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for less than a year. In the future, Erma hopes to improve the general living conditions of her  family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Las Americas Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento Las Américas está  compuesto por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un varón la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  María en la foto la presidenta de la banca de emprendimiento, viste  pantalón azul, blusa rosada y chamarra color crema  es la primera del lado derecho de la foto, ella tiene 21 años y es soltera con un hijo que tiene la edad de seis meses de gestación , ella se dedica a la fabricación de zapatos en su taller que se encuentra ubicado en la zona las Américas,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. María  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de una maquina pulidora de zapatos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo la Sra. María enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la compra de distintas maquinarias para elaborar variedad de calzados y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando maquinarias y materiales para su negocio y así poder generar mayores ingresos,  La Sra. María es una persona muy trabajadora sola saca delante a su familia, esta es la única actividad con la que se mantiene, se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos como el de ella mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The “Banco de Emprendimiento Las Américas” communal bank is made up of nine members, eight woman and one gentleman.  Maria is the bank’s president and appears first on the right in the photograph wearing blue pants, a reddish blouse, and a cream-colored jacket.  She is 21 years old, single, with one six month old son.  She makes shoes in her workshop, located in the Las Americas zone.  This will be her first loan through the institution and she plans to use the money to buy a shoe polishing machine.  She is requesting this loan because she lacks capital and has other challenges, such as having to buy other tools to make a variety of shoe types.  She wants to use these benefits to buy tools and supplies for her business and generate more income.  Maria is a hardworking women and moves her family forward on her own.  This is her only business and she is happy about the opportunity presented to her and the other members of her group, as some of them are also the sole support for their families.

loans.use: to buy a shoe polisher.

loans.name: Leon Antonio

texts.es:
León es un hombre de 42 años, soltero, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, caracterizada por su clima cálido y hermosas playas; León es un hombre muy trabajador, persevante, con un gran sentido del humor, en sus ratos libres le gusta ir de pesca con sus buenos amigos y en algunas ocasiones prepara un riquísimo “Lomo Saltado” para compartir en sus días de pesca.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias a su espíritu emprendedor, León trabaja desde hace muchos años en su negocio de cerrajería, dedicado a elaborar puertas y ventanas metálicas, él labora un aproximado de 10 horas diarias, León cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a su dedicación, a los buenos acabados en sus trabajos y al trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
León se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales para su negocio, tales como: bisagras, vigas de hierro, pintura, anticorrosivo, chapas, entre otros; de esta manera León podrá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes e incrementará sus ingresos económicos, con los cuales mas adelante espera poder adquirir una motocarga.
texts.en:
Leon, 42, is single.  He lives in Camana, a city known for its mild climate and beautiful beaches.  Leon is a hard-working, tenacious man with a good sense of humor.  He likes to go fishing with his friends when he can and he often makes his famous "lomo saltado" for all to share.
Leon has an enterprising spirit and he has operated his own metal-working business for many years now.  He works 10 hours a day, making metal doors and windows.  He says that the business is successful because he works hard, is good at what he does, and provides a good service that his customers value.
Leon wants Kiva lenders to know that he is grateful for your support.  He will use the loan to buy the materials he needs--hinges, metal beams, pain, rust coating, metal plating, etc.--to operate the business.  The investment will allow him to provide a better service to his customers and, in turn, grow his business and income.  In the future, he would like to buy a motorized vehicle for transporting supplies and inventory.

loans.use: to buy materials for his metal-working business.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: Maria Ines se dedica a la venta de ropa para mujeres, hombres y niños. Vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil hace 34 años, su casa es propia y es uno de los motivos por lo que está contenta ya que se libra de pagar alquiler. Maria Ines tiene 56 años y es separada, sus 2 hijos están casados pero viven con ella. Nos comenta que empezó vendiendo artículos para el hogar a conocidos, a partir de eso vio que tenia clientela por lo que decidió vender ropa exclusivamente. Recorre la zona vendiendo y cobrando sus artículos solo en la tarde ya que en la mañana se dedica a lavar ropa ajena para poderse ayudar. Ella nos comenta que solo vende bajo pedido ya que de otra manera se quedaría con el producto y no podría venderlo. Espera obtener el crédito comprando mercadería como pantalones, blusas, short para tener en inventario. Le gustaría a futuro tener un local estable para no salir mucho a recorrer las calles.
texts.en: Maria Ines sells clothing for men, women and children. She’s lived in the Guayaquil suburb for 34 years and owns her house, something she is happy about since she’s free of paying rent. Maria Ines is 56 years old, separated and her two sons are married and live with her. She tells us that she started selling articles for the home to friends and then seeing that she had clientele, she began selling clothing exclusively. She walks around selling her clothing and collecting only in the afternoons because in the mornings she is washes clothes for people, another way she helps herself. She tells us that she only sells by orders to ensure the purchase. She is requesting a loan to invest in buying merchandise, like pants, blouses, and shorts, to have in inventory. In the future she would like to have a stable location so she won’t have to be out selling on the streets.

loans.use: buy pants, blouses and shorts.

loans.name: Karolina Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Karolina sigue en el negocio del cultivo de la piña el cual le genera ingresos para ayudarle con los gastos de su casa. Karolina necesita en estos momentos darle mantenimiento a sus plantas de piñas ya que con las lluvias sufren mucho de plagas inundaciones en los plantillos y ella quiere tener una buena cosecha para vender a un buen precios. Ella con este financiamiento comprara insumos, fertilizantes, urea para que sus piñas crezcan saludables y sean de mayor calidad. Gracias a Afodenic podrá realizar su meta en esta cosecha.
texts.en: Ms. Karolina continues to cultivate pineapples from which she is able to create earnings that help her with her household expenses. At this moment, Karolina needs to maintain her pineapple plants as the rainy seasons can cause flooding in the fields and she wants to have a good harvest so she can sell them for a good price. With this loan, she will purchase supplies,  fertilizers and urea (used as a nitrogen source) so that her pineapples grow healthy and are of the highest quality. Thanks to Afodenic she will be able to realize her harvest goals.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and urea

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
Carmelo, solicita un nuevo préstamo para su negocio agrícola, pues está en la temporada donde se inicia la milpa, para esto el deberá comprarse abono, herbicidas, para aplicarlos al maíz y frijol que cultivara, con estos materiales podrá mejorar su producción y prevenir de plagas.
Con el préstamo anterior Carmelo logro la construcción de su vivienda, así mismo mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, estando en la actualidad más cómodos.
texts.en: Carmelo is asking for a new loan for his agriculture business, because it is planting season and he should purchase fertilizer and herbicides to use on his corn and beans that he cultivates because with these materials he will be able to improve his production and prevent plague/pests. With his previous loan, Carmelo was able to build his home and improve his family's living conditions and they are currently much more comfortable.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and herbicides to use on his corn and beans.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married woman having 2 children. She is 45 years old, residing at Mantik, Tangub City, Philippines. Elizabeth owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been 2 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.. She joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Elizabeth wants to build a house and to finish the study of her children.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Henrietta

texts.en: Henrietta is a married woman who has 6 children. She is 59 years old, and resides at New Village, Tambulig, Philippines. Henrietta owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She's been 10 years in this business. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop. In 2009, Henrietta joined GDMPC. In the future, Henrietta wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop

loans.name: Telmo Anibal

texts.es: Telmo de 58 años se dedica a la reparación de artículos electrónicos en su domicilio ubicado en Suburbio. Hace 10 años aprendió el oficio trabajando para un amigo y le gusto mucho. A raíz de eso se dio cuenta que le gustaba mucho esta profesión y la mantiene hasta el día de hoy. Actualmente es independiente contando con bastantes clientes. Arregla lo que son televisores, reproductores de dvd, equipos de sonido, etc. el trabajo lo realiza desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. No tiene ayudantes ya que de momento el negocio no le da suficientes ganancias para contratar uno y pagarle de manera diga por sus servicios. Telmo nos indica que uno de sus más grandes problemas se presenta cuando los clientes no retiran los equipos que mandan a reparar. Con el crédito comprar diodos, chips, herramientas que necesita para la reparación. Su meta futura es poder habilitar otros departamentos para alquilar ya que con esto se ayuda en la economía. Su sueño es que uno de sus nietos le guste la electrónica y la aprenda.
texts.en: Telmo, 58, repairs electronics in his home located in Suburbio. He learned this trade 10 years ago, working for a friend and he really enjoyed it. So, from this experience, he realized that he really liked this profession and has been doing it from that day until now. He is independent and has lots of clients. He repairs televisions, DVD players, stereos, etc. He works from 8 am to 6pm. He has no help as he can’t afford to pay someone a dignified wage for their services. Telmo tells us that the biggest problem he faces is when the clients don’t pick-up their equipment after it’s been repaired. With this loan, he will buy diodes, chips and tools that he needs to make repairs. His future goal is to renovate other apartments so he can rent them out and that would help him out economically. His dream is that one of his grandsons will enjoy electronics and learn the trade.

loans.use: buy diodes, chips and tools.

loans.name: Benito Ricardo

texts.es: Benito a sus 63 años es una persona muy productiva, le gusta mantenerse activo y por eso tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. Vive en las Orquídeas sector norte de Guayaquil. Su esposa Pascuala es ama de casa y sus hijos son mayores de edad. El nos comenta que el negocio lo inicio su hija teniendo buenos resultados por lo que decidió invertir. Luego de esto su hija se quedo con el bazar y él empezó su tienda de productos. Benito nos comenta que inicia sus actividades a las 6:30 de la mañana luego de atender a su esposa, cerrando a las 11 de la noche. Ya tiene 10 años en el negocio y no se queja porque con ello mantiene a su esposa quien esta delicada de salud. Los productos que vende son de fácil salida como cuadernos, plumas, colas, jugos, snacks, víveres, arroz, azúcar, pañales, espera poder incrementar sus ventas con el préstamo ya que tendría más productos para la venta.
texts.en: Benito at his 63 years is a very productive person.  He likes to stay active, so he has a grocery store in his home.  He lives in Orquídeas, a section of Guayaquil.  His wife, Pascuala, is a housewife and their children are fully grown.  He says that his daughter started the business and had good results.  She later kept the paper goods store and he started the grocery store.  Benito tells us that he begins working at 6:30 am and closes at 11:00 pm.  He’s been doing this for 10 years and he doesn’t complain because he supports his wife with it and she has health problems.  The items he has, such as notebooks, pens, colas, juices, snacks, food, rice, sugar, and diapers are quick sellers.   He expects to increase his sales with the help of this loan because he will have more products for sale.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Perfecto

texts.es:
El señor Perfectos es un agricultor desde hace 40 años prácticamente casi toda su vida a trabajado en esto y es parte de sus ingresos al  hogar, el cultiva 2 manzanas de  tierra en piñas y desea darles mantenimiento para tener una buena  cosecha y poder vender en un buen precio  su producto.
Gracias a este financiamiento que se le otorga podrá comprar los suministros necesarios  como Urea, completo, cipermetrina para que sus cultivos crezcan sanos.
texts.en:
Sr. Perfectos, 40, is a farmer.  He has worked on farms for almost his whole life and farming is his sole source of income.  He grows pineapples on 2 tracts of land and says that he needs to take care of the crop in order to get the best price for it at market.  
He will use this loan to buy the supplies he needs--fertilizer, etc.--to ensure a good yield.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Narin

texts.en:
Narin (pictured here), age 26, is a garment worker. She lives about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her husband, Sokha, age 27, has full time employment. They have just been married since 2012 and have no children yet.   

Narin is applying for her first loan of 1,500 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband to get to work. Narin’s husband works at Phnom Penh and he rents a place of house to stay. With a motorbike, which he will buy with money from the loan, he will be able to come back home every evening to help support his wife at home.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to get to work.

loans.name: Hoeurng

texts.en:
Hoeurng is 52 years old. She is a mother of five children and resides with her husband in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than 4 years, earning approximately 5 USD per day. Her husband helps her run the business. All of her children are still in her care. 

In order to improve her family’s finance, Hoeurng is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase more groceries to sell. By doing so, she would earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Neth

texts.en:
Neth is 64 years old. She is widowed and resides with one child in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling Khmer noodle for more than 7 years, earning approximately 4 USD per day. Her child is employed and earns about 3 USD per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finance, Neth is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD to purchase clothes to resell. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell

loans.name: Ayidote Minavo Group

texts.fr: AYIDOTE MINAVO est un groupement de vingt deux personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, Christine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Clément. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Christine n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Christine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges de la maison, Christine vend depuis près cinq ans, divers produits (farine de manioc, savons, huile de palme) dans une région du Bénin. Christine s’approvisionne dans sa région. C’est la première fois que, Christine et les autres membres du groupe AYIDOTE MINAVO sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: AYIDOTE MINAVO is a group of twenty two people who live in the same village. The representative of the group, Christine (who has her hand raised in the photo) is 40 years old and is married to a farmer called Clement. They have six children, all of whom go to school and are dependent on them. Christine did not go to school. She lives with her children and her husband. The couple shares the various expenses of the household. In order to contribute to the household expenses, for the last five years Christine has been selling different products (manioc flour, soap, palm oil) in a region in Benin. Christine buys her products in her district. This is the first time that Christine and the other members of the AYIDOTE  MINAVO group request financial support from ALIDé with a view to strengthening their working capital and their business and improving the satisfaction of their customers.

loans.use: to buy manioc flour and palm oil.

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan owns a cellphone counter named based on the street where he lives. His shop is located in an intersection where a lot of people passing by with motorcycles or walking. In his shop, other than selling Ruma’s prepaid cell phone minutes, Ruslan also sells some drinks and does small phone repair services. The reason why he decided to join Ruma’s Loket Ruma bill-payment business is because he sees the demand especially to pay electricity bills and landline phone bills. 

Ruslan is married and has three children who are 27, 20, and 7 years old. With this loan he wants to expand his business. By becoming a Loket Ruma agent, people will come to his counter and pay their bills or buy prepaid electricity vouchers.

This loan is going to be used to pay the deposit for an Electronic Data Capture (EDC) machine. All the payment transactions will use the EDC machine to process everything. Above all, Ruslan’s goal is to generate more profit from his business.

loans.use: To pay for a deposit on an electronic data capture (EDC) machine for his bill payment business

loans.name: Orlandine

texts.es:
Orlandine tiene 30 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposa y su pequeña hija de tan solo 5 años de edad y por la cual trabaja muy duro cada día para darle una vida digna y sobre todo que sea feliz. Su vivienda se encuentra en la ciudad de Imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo en esta ciudad se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, maíz, plátano, entre otros. Orlandine anteriormente vivía en un distrito alejado de Imperial pero debido a las lluvias perdió su casa y tuvo que emigrar hacia la ciudad de Imperial ya que se quedo sin nada ni un lugar donde vivir, debido a ello un familiar cercano lo ayudo y le brindo vivienda. Desde hace 10 años, Orlandine trabaja como carpintero, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 7 clientes diariamente; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque a pesar de las adversidades sigue saliendo adelante y sobre todo porque tiene mucha fe en Dios.

Orlandine está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá implementar mejor su negocio con herramientas como cepillos de madera, cortadora y mejorar su local, así el podrá tener las herramientas adecuadas y sobre todo un mejor lugar donde poder realizar su trabajo, de esta manera el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y así seguir trabajando y luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño.” Darle una buena profesión a su hija y poder crecer en su negocio”.
texts.en:
Orlandine, 30, lives with his wife and little daughter, who is only five years old.  He works very hard every day to give her a decent life and above all for her to be happy.

His house is in the city of Imperial, a city distinguished by its warm and welcoming climate.  There is also agriculture in this city, especially the crops of cotton, corn, and bananas, among others.  Previously Orlandine lived in a district far away from Imperial but he lost his home from the rains and was left with nothing, not even a place to live, so he had to migrate to Imperial.  Because of this a neighboring family helped him and gave him a place to live.

Orlandine has worked as a carpenter for 10 years.  He works around 10 hours a day and can serve up to seven customers.  He believes that it's going well for him in his business because he continues getting ahead despite the adversities and especially because he has a lot of faith in God.

Orlandine is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he will be able to equip his business better, with tools such as wood brushes and a saw, and make improvements on his shop.  This way he'll have suitable tools and a better place to do his job.  He'll be able to improve his income and continue working and fighting to make his biggest dream come true: "To give his daughter a good profession and be able to grow in his business."

loans.use: to buy tools and to improve his shop.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is 41 years old and married with 2 children, who are in school. Leonora works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery stock to sell. Leonora has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, detergent and rum. In the future, Leonora would like to save enough to continue her children's education and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery stock to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is 52 years old, married, and has four children. For over 14 years in Poblacion, Bonifacio, she has made a living by selling fruits and vegetables. She earns 4,000 PHP a month from this business. In 2011, Rosita joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more produce to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Tovinonvigbe Group

texts.fr: TOVINONVIGBE est un groupement de douze personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, Brigitte (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 44 ans et est mariée à un certain Erick. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. En plus de leur enfant, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Brigitte vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de trois ans, Brigitte vend du maïs et des conditions dans une région du Bénin, ce qui lui permet de contribuer aux diverses charges familiales. Brigitte s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Brigitte et les autres membres du groupe TOVINONVIGBE sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: TOVINONVIGBE is a group of twelve people, whose members live in the same village. The representative of the group, Brigitte (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 44 years old and married to a man named Erick. The couple has a child who attends school and is dependent on them. In addition to their child, they have another child who is dependent on them. Brigitte lives with her husband and her children. The couple shares the household expenses. For three years, Brigitte has been selling corn and condiments in a locality in Benin which enables her to contribute to the family expenses. Brigitte buys her products in a region of Benin. This is the first time that Brigitte and the other members of the TOVINONVIGBE group request financial aid from ALIDé with a view to strengthening the working capital of their business and to give more satisfaction to their customers.

loans.use: to buy corn and condiments.

loans.name: Sohoueto 3 Group

texts.fr: SOHOUETO 3 est un groupement de vingt trois personnes, dont les membres se connaissent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe,  Adjuavi Marie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 60 ans et est mariée à un certain Philippe. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un reste à leur charge.  Adjuavi Marie a très peu fréquenté l’école.  Adjuavi Marie vit ensemble avec son enfant à charge et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de dix ans,  Adjuavi Marie vend des céréales (riz, maïs, haricot, farine de manioc, huile) à son  domicile.  Adjuavi Marie s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. C’est la première fois que  Adjuavi Marie et les autres membres du groupe SOHOUETO 3 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
SOHOUETO 3 is a group of 23 persons whose members know one another in the same district. The group's representative, Adjuavi Marie (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 60 years old and married to a man named Philippe. They have four children, all having schooling, of whom one remains in their care. 

Adjuavi Marie has had very little schooling. She lives together with her dependent child and her husband. The couple jointly ensures that the different household expenses are covered. 

For nearly ten years, Adjuavi Marie has been selling grains (rice, corn, beans, cassava flour, oil) out of her home. She gets her supplies from a region in Benin. 

This is the first time Adjuavi Marie and the other members of the group SOHOUETO 3 have requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of bolster their working capital and their businesses and to respond better to the requirements of their customers.

loans.use: to buy sacks of  rice, corn, and beans

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha vive en las Orquídeas sector norte de Guayaquil. Tiene 33 años y está casada con Silvestre quien se dedica a la venta de jugos y granizados. Hace 12 años tomo la decisión de abrir un bazar en su domicilio. Empezó vendiendo productos de belleza y ropa por catalogo, con las ganancias que obtuvo compro una vitrina en la que expone sus productos. Actualmente vende cuadernos, cartulina, plumas, borradores, colonias, moños etc. de esta manera a obtenido mejores ganancias. Atiende todos los días desde las 6 y media hasta las 10 y media, su estrategia es abrir temprano por la época estudiantil. Tiene 4 hijos de 4, 3, 2 y 1 año de edad, solo dos estudian en la escuela fiscal del barrio. Espera obtener el préstamo para comprar mercadería con esto incrementara el bazar ya que es el sustento de su familia.
texts.en: Martha lives in Las Orquídeas to the north of Guayaquil. She is 33 years old. She is married to Silvestre who sells juices and iced drinks. Twelve years ago, Martha made the decision to open a bazaar in her home. She started by selling beauty products and clothing from catalogs. With the earnings from those sales, she bought a display cabinet to show her products. Currently, she sells notebooks, poster board, pens, erasers and other items in order to earn more income. She works at her shop every day from half past six until half past ten. Her strategy is to open early for the students. She has four children. They are four, three, two and one years old. Two of them attend a local school. She hopes to obtain this loan in order to purchase merchandise. With the merchandise, she will be able to expand the bazaar since it is  her family’s means of support.

loans.use: purchase supplies like notebooks, poster board, pens, etc.

loans.name: Ahuehuete Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes del grupo continúan en la misma actividad que que estaban desempeñando. Todos ellos le dan las gracias a Kiva y a Vision Fund (FRAC) por confiar en ellos: ""stamos agradecidos con ustedes por ayudarnos a crecer los negocios y con nuestras familias". 

La señora Gina Rebeca tiene 39 años de edad y vive en unión libre con su pareja quien es taxista. Es madre de 3 hijos: 2 mujeres, una de ellas ya está casada, y 1 varón, también casado. Gina Rebeca solicitó su préstamo para darle mantenimiento a sus taxis; a uno le va a ajustar el motor y al otro le va a dar servicio: cambio de aceite, de balatas y de llantas. Ella comenzó su actividad económica hace 16 años porque algunos conocidos la invitaron a formar parte del grupo de taxistas y le pareció una buena idea. 

Su negocio es muy importante porque gracias a él obtiene las ganancias para comprar alimento, vestido y calzado; además de que tiene la oportunidad de ahorrar. Gina Rebeca es conocida por brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes. Como mujer emprendedora enfrenta los costos elevados de la gasolina, sin embargo, está muy feliz con el préstamo que va a recibir. Con el dinero prestado podrá ajustar el motor de su taxi para que esté en buenas condiciones y pueda seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio. Sus sueños y esperanzas son que toda su familia goce de buena salud y también seguir trabajando para heredarles a sus hijos el negocio de los taxis en un futuro.
texts.en:
The members of the group are continuing to carry out the same work as they have been. They are all grateful to Kiva and the Vision Fund (FRAC) for trusting in them; “We are thankful to you for helping us grow our business and support our families.” 
	
Gina Rebeca is 39 and lives in a common-law marriage with her partner, who is a taxi driver. She is the mother of 3 children: 2 females, one of whom is married, and 1 male, who is also married. Gina Rebeca has requested the loan for maintenance on her taxis. She will adjust the engine of one and will service the other: changing the oil, brake lining, and tires. She started her work 16 years ago because some of her acquaintances invited her to be part of a group of taxi drivers, and it seemed like a good idea to her. 

Her business is very important because it allows her to earn an income to purchase food, clothes, and shoes; in addition, it gives her the opportunity to save money. Gina Rebeca is known for offering her clients good service. This enterprising woman faces the increased cost of gasoline; nevertheless, she is very happy to receive the loan. With the loan, she will be able to adjust the engine of the taxi so it will be in good condition and can continue offering good service. Her hopes and dreams are that all her family can enjoy good health. She also hopes to continue working so that she can leave the taxi business to her children in the future.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her taxis: changing oil, brake lining, and tires, and adjusting the engine.

loans.name: Martha Delia

texts.es: Desde Isla Trinitaria conocemos a Martha quien vende ropa y cosméticos de manera ambulante. Tiene 37 años y se considera una persona muy dinámica y conversona. De allí surgió la idea ya que sus familiares le indicaron que tenía carisma para vender. Empezó con la venta de productos para ver si obtenía resultados y así fue. Ahora vende ropa porque es de más fácil salida y le deja mejores ganancias. Ella nos comenta que sus productos son de buena calidad y vende los vestidos a $25 dólares, perfumes a $ 20 y las cremas a $ 20 teniendo 5 dólares de utilidad por producto. Martha es madre soltera de un niño de 6 años quien asiste a la escuela fiscal es por eso que lucha día a día, recorriendo y vendiendo. Con el crédito que solicita comprara productos para el negocio. Espera en próximos años tener un local para poder dedicarle más tiempo a su hijo.
texts.en:
On Isla Trinitaria we meet Martha, who sells clothing and cosmetics in the street.   She is 37 and is considered to be a very dynamic and talkative person.  From this, an idea arose because her family pointed out that she had the charisma to sell.  She began by selling products to see if she would get results, and so it was.  Now she sells clothing because it is quite easy to go out with and it gives her more profit.  She tells us that her products are of good quality, and she sells the dresses at $25, perfumes at $20, and the creams at $20, taking $5 of profit per product.  

Martha is a single mother of one child who is 6-years-old and goes to public school.  This is why she fights day to day, traveling through the streets and selling.  With the loan she has asked for, she will buy products for her business.  In the next few years she hopes to have a small shop in order to be able to spend more time with her son.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and creams.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Oun is 40 years old and married. She has two boys who are both students. Her family lives in a wooden house located in the Me Mot district. 

Oun and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava for 20 years to support the family. This is the first time Oun obtained a loan from VisionFund. For her group member, this is the second loan. 

Oun is the leader of the group, and she used her portion to buy fertilizers for her crops and also to spend on land plowing. She hopes this loan will help to better feed her family and that her children can be in school until graduated.

loans.use: To pay for land plowing and fertilizers.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Me Mot district

loans.name: Sabana

texts.en:
Sabana is 22 years old and her husband, Sophea, is 27 years old. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2008 and have one young daughter.    

Sabana is a garment worker. Sabana’s husband’s business is in renting out his van to drive garment workers to work and back home. Unhappily, his van broke and he decided to sell it. 

She is applying for her first loan in the amount of $1,500 to buy a new van for her husband. He will use money from selling his old van to add to money from the loan to buy a new one.

loans.use: To buy a new van for her husband.

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie, a 25-year-old married mother of one child, lives in Sta. Maria, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental.

For over five years, she has made a living through the operation of a retail store selling a variety of paper products. She earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Angelie joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Sarin is 57 years old and his wife, Sony, is 50 years old. They have been married since 1979 and they have four sons and three daughters. Two are married and live separately, one is a garment worker, one is an auto repairman, one stays at home and the other two attend school. The family lives in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sarin and his wife are primary school teachers. He is requesting his first loan in the amount of $1,300 to buy a motorbike for his son, who is a garment worker, to get to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his son to get to work.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 51 years old and lives in Upper Centro,Tudela. She is widowed with two children. Edna works as a government employee and earns approximately PHP 5000 each month. Edna has requested a loan of PHP 20000 to purchase additional housing materials and equipment. Edna has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Edna hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional housing materials and equipment.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 30 years old and has four children who all go to school. She owns a retail business where she sells different items and has spent 10 years in the business. With the loan, she will buy more beer, sugar, yeast, sorghum and bananas for resale. She wants to use the profits to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more beer, sugar, yeast, sorghum and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en: Jenelyn, 22, is single and lives in Balon,Tudela. She grows crops to earn a living and has been doing this for five years. Jenelyn has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase additional fertilizer, such as inorganic and commercial types. Jenelyn has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Jenelyn hopes to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer, such as inorganic and commercial.

loans.name: Sohoueto 4 Group

texts.fr: SOHOUETO 4 est un groupement de vingt quatre personnes, dont les membres se connaissent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Florentine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un certain Jacques. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Florentine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Florentine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de onze ans, Florentine vend divers produits (conserves, lait, pâtes alimentaires, etc.) à son domicile. Florentine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Florentine et les autres membres du groupe SOHOUETO 4 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
SOHOUETO 4 is a group of 24 persons whose members know one another in the same district. The group's representative, Florentine (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 38 years old and married to a man named Jacques. They have three children, all in school and in their care. 

Florentine did not go to school. She lives together with her children and her husband. The couple jointly ensures that the different household expenses are covered. 

For nearly eleven years, Florentine has been selling grains (canned food, milk, pasta, etc.) out of her home. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

This is the first time Florentine and the other members of the group SOHOUETO 4 have requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of bolster their working capital and their businesses and to respond better to the demands of their customers.

loans.use: to buy various goods (canned foods, milk, pasta, etc.)

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosario vive en Quevedo junto a su esposo quien labora en el campo. A sus 46 años es panificadora, aprendió el negocio de su esposo quien le enseño la elaboración. Hace 7 años juntos reunieron el capital necesario para abrir la panadería la cual está ubicada en su domicilio. Comenzaron comprando un horno de segunda mano pero actualmente tienen uno nuevo. Ella empieza la elaboración del pan desde las 3 de la mañana con la ayuda de su esposo y termina a las 2 de la tarde, luego de eso empieza la venta.
